p: Another formulation of the SIR model is presented as dS( t)/ dt=− βS( t) I( t), dI( t)/ dt= βS( t) I( t)− γI( t) and dR( t)/ dt= γI( t), where the population size N is implicitly absorbed into the parameter of disease transmission rate β, which may be interpreted as a per capita effective contact in proportion to the population (see, e.g. Johnson & McQuarrie, 2009). Despite the differences in notations and presentations, they convey the same infection mechanism, but interpretations need to be given accordingly. Although we use these model specifications exchangeably in this paper, the form given in ( 2) is recommended to conduct practical studies.
